title: Russian Missiles Deliver New Woe to Kyiv, Knocking Out Tap Water
description: Moscow kept up its campaign to destroy civilian infrastructure, in an apparent bid — so far unsuccessful — to break Ukrainian morale by making cities unlivable.

title: What does the transition of power entail in Brazil?
Your Tuesday Briefing: Jair Bolsonaro Loses
description: But he has not conceded Brazil’s presidential election.

title: Rishi Sunak’s First Crisis: Turmoil Engulfing His Home Secretary
description: Suella Braverman has come under political fire for breaching security rules and for her handling of immigration issues.

title: Global Wheat Prices Rise After Russia Suspends Grain Deal
South Korea Halloween Deaths Were ‘Absolutely Avoidable’ Disaster, Experts Say
description: Days after the deaths of more than 150 young people, officials were still struggling to explain what exactly went wrong and who was to blame.

title: Sea Drone Attack on Russian Fleet Puts Focus on Expanded Ukrainian Arms
description: Military experts say that the apparent use of remote-controlled boats to attack Russian ships over the weekend is likely to demonstrate a new capability for Ukrainian forces.

title: Key Evidence in Report on Missing Mexican Students Cannot Be Verified, Experts Say
description: An international panel said it had found numerous inconsistencies in evidence presented by the government’s truth commission on the disappearance of the 43 students in 2014.

title: Oleg Tinkov, Former Banking Tycoon, Renounces Russian Citizenship
description: The multimillionaire said on Instagram that he “can’t and won’t be associated with a fascist country.”

title: Live Updates: Brazilians Await Bolsonaro’s Response to His Election Loss
description: The leader of Brazil has yet to concede after his defeat to his leftist opponent on Sunday, raising fears that he could refuse to accept the results and set off unrest.

title: What Lula’s Victory in Brazil Means for Climate
description: The president-elect once helped slash deforestation rates in the Amazon rainforest. He says he wants to do it again.

title: Kyiv Residents Line Up At Wells After City Loses Running Water
description: Before the latest round of assaults on Ukrainian infrastructure, a buzz had returned to the capital.

title: Aging Infrastructure May Create Higher Flood Risk in L.A., Study Finds
description: Between 197,000 and 874,000 city residents could experience a foot of flooding during an extreme storm, scientists found. Most of them don’t live in beachfront mansions.

title: How a Festive Stroll Over a Historic Bridge Turned to Carnage in India
description: After the deaths of at least 140 pedestrians, the country is asking why its infrastructure has failed so calamitously once again.

title: What Is COP27?
description: With the world still struggling to get global warming under control, diplomats will gather in Egypt for United Nations climate talks. Here are some key facts.

title: Bolsonaro Is Silent After Brazil Election Defeat
description: President Jair Bolsonaro has not yet recognized his election defeat after months of warning, without evidence, that opponents would rig the vote.

title: Russian Missile Barrage Targets Kyiv and Other Cities
description: Ukraine said that its forces shot down most of the Russian missiles, but strikes cut off the water supply to 80 percent of Kyiv, at least temporarily.

title: China Launches Its Space Station’s Third and Final Module
description: Completing the Tiangong space station is the latest step in Beijing’s effort to match and eventually surpass the United States in space exploration.

title: Russian Missile Debris Lands in Moldova
description: Parts of a Russian missile intercepted by Ukrainian air defenses landed in a Moldovan border village on Monday.

title: More Equitable Justice
description: Racial disparities in incarceration have fallen.

title: What to do in a crowd crush.
description: Experts say that when a group is packed so close together that no one can move, their airways can become constricted. Victims can suffocate even while standing.

title: Fragile, Delicate, Free: Glimpses of Circus Life, at Sea
description: A photographer embedded with the Sea Clown Sailing Circus on the troupe’s journeys through the Mediterranean. Here’s what he saw.

title: Cholera Outbreaks Surge Worldwide, Following Floods, Droughts and Wars
description: A record number of outbreaks has drained the cholera vaccine supply, leading the W.H.O. to ration emergency vaccinations.

title: Will Bolsonaro Dispute the Results of Brazil’s Presidential Election?
description: President Jair Bolsonaro has spent years attacking Brazil’s democratic institutions.

title: He’s an Outspoken Defender of Meat. Industry Funds His Research, Files Show.
description: A UC Davis professor runs an academic center that was conceived by a trade group, according to records, and gets most of its funding from farming interests.

title: Young Dreams Extinguished in the Crush of a Halloween Crowd in Seoul
description: More than 100 of those killed in the crowd crush were in their 20s, planning for the next chapter of their lives.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: A devastating tragedy in Seoul.

title: Brazil Ejects Bolsonaro and Brings Back Former Leftist Leader Lula
description: Brazilians voted out their far-right leader, Jair Bolsonaro, after a single term and replaced him with former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.

title: In an evangelical church, attendees pray for a Bolsonaro victory.
Bolsonaro, in Defeat, May Now Face Charges
description: Brazil’s president has faced investigations that have been staved off or blocked so far given his presidential immunity. But that may now change of his defeat in Sunday’s election.

title: Russia Is Urged to Rejoin Grain Deal as Hunger Warnings Mount
description: Moscow dismissed accusations that it was using food as a weapon and said Ukraine was to blame for its decision to suspend an agreement that allowed for grain shipments.
